greenmirror.client

Class GridBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenmirror.client.GridBuilder

  • public class GridBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    An auxiliary class that makes building grids on the visualizer significantly less tedious. It uses the builder design pattern, so use it like this: new GridBuilder("nodes_type:nodes_nameprefix") .setOPTION() .build(xCoordinate, yCoordinate) .getNodes(); This retrieves the nodes that the grid consists of: one node for each cell and one extra for the background. The cell nodes will get a name consisting of the specified prefix, followed by the cell number (starting with the number zero). The background node will get a name consisting of the specified prefix followed by "background".

    The only properties that are required are the cell count and the cell width and height. All other properties have a default value of zero or null. It is highly recommended to set the fill property of either the cells or the background, because those default to a black color.

    Author:
    Karim El Assal

    • Constructor Detail

      • GridBuilder

        public GridBuilder(java.lang.String gridIdentifier)
        Starts the gruid builder, directly setting the type property of the nodes and the name prefix. Both are optional: an empty string or null value is allowed.
        Parameters:
        gridIdentifier - the identifier consisting of the type property and the name prefix the nodes should receive. Optional. See Node.Identifier

      • build

        public @NonNull GridBuilder build(double posX,
                                  double posY)
        Builds the grid. All properties should have a valid value by the time this method is called. Call getNodes() to get the created nodes.
        Parameters:
        posX - the x coordinate where the top left corner of the grid should be placed
        posY - the y coordinate where the top left corner of the grid should be placed
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a property has an invalid value
